intro: Lisowskia weberbaueriana, commonly known as the Weberbauer's lisowskia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
